SECOND AMENDMENT TO COUNTERPETITION FOR CONTEMPT
COMES now the Plaintiff, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his attorney of
record, Dianne James Davis, and realleges all allegations contained in his previously filed
Counterpetition for Contempt and Amendment to Counterpetition for Contempt and would
further show the Court the following:
COUNT III
1) That on or about October 29, 2025, the Defendant filed a Motion to Dismiss the
Contempt Petition for Non-Payment of Support that was filed by the State of
Alabama on behalf of the Plaintiff on or about July 31, 2025 and to consolidate
the .02 case into the .01 case.
2) That on the 2nd day of November, 2025, the Court entered an Order granting said
motion.
3) That the State of Alabama was managing child support on behalf of the Plaintiff.
However, once the Motion to Dismiss had been filed and the Order entered
granting said motion, the State of Alabama informed the Plaintiff that they would
not be managing his child support case any longer.
4) That the Defendant has failed and/or refused to pay child support to the Plaintiff
as ordered by the Court in the Final Judgment of Divorce entered on the 27th day
of February, 2024, and is currently in arrears in the amount of $1,451.33.
5) That further, the Defendant has failed and/or refused to pay her share of all
medical expenses since the Final Decree of Divorce was entered on February 27,
2024, and currently owes the sum of $1,763.70.
DOCUMENT 433
6) That the Defendant has the ability to pay child support for the benefit and
maintenance of the minor children.
7) That the Plaintiff had to retain counsel to file this action and has incurred legal
fees. Plaintiff respectfully requests that the Defendant be ordered to pay said
attorneyâ€™s fees incurred in connection with the filing of this action.
WHEREFORE, the premises considered, the Plaintiff respectfully requests that this
Honorable Court require the Defendant to appear and state what reasons, if any, that she has for
not abiding by the Final Judgment of Divorce and why she should not be held in willful
contempt for failure to do so. The Plaintiff further requests that the Defendant be ordered to pay
his attorney fees incurred with the filing of this action. The Plaintiff requests all such other relief
to which he may be entitled, the premises considered.
Respectfully submitted this the 14th day of November, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff

Alexander City, AL 35010
